title: Add ability to change max number of open files for users
body: Currently it doesn't appear possible to change max number of open files for a non-root user.  ulimit -n give error.  Documentation on Ubuntu, points to changing /etc/security/limits, etc but this doesn't appear to work.

comments.body: Only 12 votes as of today?  This is huge.  You can't use windows bash as a professional dev environment until this is fixed.
You cannot. That limit is global on Windows, not per-subsystem.

Ran into similar issue while running into unit tests for one of the open source projects. I had to move back to mac because of this issue. If Git bash is positioned to be as dev environment. This needs to be fixed!
